issues.description: The templateâ€™s Farm.java declares a class named AnimalFarm (and even contains nested declarations and an illegal package statement inside a method), whereas the problem statement and solution expect a class named Farm. This mismatch will prevent students from having a Farm class to implement and will break references in Main (which uses Farm).
issues.suggested_fix: In Farm.java, rename AnimalFarm to Farm, remove the illegal nested class and package declaration, and ensure the public class matches the name Farm as specified in the problem statement and solution.

issues.description: Template repository defines the farm class as `AnimalFarm` (Farm.java:3) whereas the problem statement and solution refer to it simply as `Farm`. This naming mismatch will confuse students when they try to implement or reference `Farm` in their code, as the template provides a class with a different identifier.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class `AnimalFarm` in the template to `Farm` so that it matches both the problem statement and the solution implementation.
